title: Verify that the Schedule Page loads properly (http status 200)
custom_steps: 1. Go to https://www.milb.com/schedule/
custom_expected: Milb Schedule Page loads properly

title: Verify that selecting a date within the datepicker the results reflect the date selected.
custom_steps:
1. Go to https://www.milb.com/schedule
2. Using the datepicker select a date in the past (year/month/day).
custom_expected: The schedule results reflect the date selected in the date picker.

title: Verify that a fan can select a Class, League, and/or a MLB Affiliate.
custom_steps:
1. Go to https://www.milb.com/schedule/
2. Select options with the class/league/mlb affiliate.
custom_expected:
Selecting Class and League will display the correct results based on the the class and league selected within the dropdowns.
Selecting MLB affiliate will reset values within class and league, only displaying the games of the MLB affiliate selected.

title: Verify that Clicking/tapping Player names opens the MiLB.com/player/* in the same tab
custom_steps:
1. Go to http://www.milb.com/schedule/
2. Using the datepicker, select a game in the past.
3. Click on a pitcher (W or L) within the schedule results.
custom_expected: Clicking/tapping on that Player navigates to that Player page.

title: Verify that basic Sanity checks with the portal section work on the club level
custom_steps:
1. Go to a club site (ex. https://www.milb.com/durham)
2. Conduct the same sanity checks from the Standings, Stats, Scores, and Schedule test cases conducted on the portal.

title: Verify that the Standings Page loads properly (http status 200)
custom_steps: Go to http://www.milb.com/standings/
custom_expected: Milb Standings Page loads properly

title: Verify that the Standings table can be filtered based on the league dropdown.
custom_steps:
1. Go to https://www.milb.com/standings/
2. In the league dropdown, select "Eastern League"
custom_expected: The Eastern League teams are now displayed in the Standings table.

title: Verify that clicking on a team within the Standings Page brings the user to that team's home page.
custom_steps:
1. Go to https://www.milb.com/standings
2. Within the league dropdown select the Eastern League option.
3. Click on Somerset (should be displayed in the Eastern League Northeast table).
custom_expected: The browser navigates to https://www.milb.com/somerset and the Somerset Patriots home page is displayed.

title: Verify that State/Province, Team, MLB Affiliation, Class and League dropdowns exist.
custom_steps: Navigate to https://www.milb.com/tickets
custom_expected: Dropdowns exist and allow user to enable checkboxes for selection of filter criteria.

title: Verify that the Apply button correctly filters on the selected checkboxes within each dropdown.
custom_steps:
Navigate to https://www.milb.com/tickets
Within the State/Province dropdown, enable only one state.
Click the Apply button.
custom_expected: Apply can be clicked. Once apply is clicked the team results displayed below the map only show the teams for the state selected. The map zooms in on the teams listed within the results.

title: Verify that the Reset button removes all enabled checkboxes within each dropdown.
custom_steps:
Navigate to https://www.milb.com/tickets
Within the State/Province dropdown, enable only one state.
Click the Apply button.
Verify that the Reset button becomes enabled. 
Click the Reset button.
custom_expected:
Once the Apply button is clicked, the Reset button enables. 
Clicking the Reset button clears all the enabled checkboxes and all filters have been cleared.
The map accurately reflects the reset action.

title: Verify that each specific dropdown category correctly filters based on the enabled checkboxes.
custom_steps:
Navigate to https://www.milb.com/tickets
Select criteria in each dropdown category(“State/Province”, “Team”, “MLB Affiliation”, “Class” and “League”).

*Run this test several times, attempting each category by itself(ex. first try filtering only on “State/Province”, then on “Team”, etc). Alternate between using one checkbox within a dropdown or several.
custom_expected: Teams listed on page accurately reflect filter selections.

title: Verify that the Tickets button next to each team navigates to the correct team ticket pages.
custom_steps:
Navigate to https://www.milb.com/tickets
Within the State/Province dropdown, enable only one state.
Click the Apply button.
Scroll to the teams listed below the Tickets map, select a team and click "Tickets".
custom_expected: Clicking a Tickets button correctly navigates to the appropriate Team's ticket page.

title: Verify that the Tickets map correctly displays the teams listed.
custom_steps:
Navigate to https://www.milb.com/tickets
Within the State/Province dropdown, enable only one state.
Click the Apply button.
custom_expected:
Verify that the Tickets map is focused on the state selected.
*Run several permutations, creating different filter criteria and verifying the map accurately reflects the teams selected.

title: Edit Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

Users who are signed in wants to edit profile from accounts page
custom_steps:
WHEN

From Homepage:
1. Go to top right corner of the page and hover over profile icon
2. Click on Edit Profile button to go to Account page
custom_expected:
THEN

User should be able to go to Account/Profile page

title: General Account Settings (Name)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

Users who are signed in, want to edit profile from accounts page
custom_steps:
WHEN

Fill out the Name fields and Save.

1. First Name
2. Middle name
3. Last Name
4. Click on Save button to save
custom_expected:
THEN

User should be able to write his/her name and save it

title: General Account Settings (Nickname)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN


Users who are signed in, want to edit profile from accounts page
custom_steps:
WHEN

1. Fillout the Nick Name
2. Click on Save button to save."
custom_expected:
THEN

User should be able to add a nick name.

title: General Account Settings (About)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

Users who are signed in, want to edit profile from accounts page
custom_steps:
WHEN

Under About, select a date of birth:

1. Select a Month from month dropdown menu
2. Select a Day from day dropdown menu
3. Select a Year from year dropdown menu
4. Click on Save button to save the date
custom_expected:
THEN

User should be able to save a date of birth

title: General Account Settings (Manage your account)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

Users who are signed in, want to edit profile from accounts page
custom_steps:
WHEN

Under Manage Your Account: 
1. Verify Delete My Account button is working
custom_expected: THEN

title: Change Your Password
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

User wants to change password from account page
custom_steps:
WHEN

Under Change Your Password fill out following fields:

1. Current Password
2. New Password
3. Re-type New Password
4. Hit Save to submit new password
custom_expected:
THEN
User should be able to fillout all fields. Following criterias should be fulfilled:

- Must be 6 - 15 characters
- One uppercase letter
- One lowercase letter
- One number
- No Special Characters

title: Log Out
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

User is trying to log out form the site
custom_steps:
WHEN

- Verify Logout option is listed under user profile dropdown
- Verify clicking/tapping on it user is logged out and the appropriate message is showing
custom_expected:
THEN

- Log in option is listed
- User can log out

title: Account Page Sections
custom_preconds: Given the user is on Account profile page
custom_steps: When the user navigates through the different sections of account profile
custom_expected: Then the respective section is displayed by verifying the section title

title: Login Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

User wants to login into milb site:
custom_steps:
WHEN

1. Type user name on Username field.
2. Type password on Password field.
3. Check "Remember me" option check box.
4. Click on "Sign In" button.
custom_expected:
THEN

- User should be able to write user name on Username page.
- User should be able to write password on password field.
- User should be able to check "Remenber me" option.
- clicking on "Sign in" should submit the request.

title: Need help signing in?
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

Need help signing in?
custom_steps:
WHEN

Following should be visible on this section:

Forgot password?
Terms of Use
Privacy Policy
Help
custom_expected:
THEN

All the links should be present and visible on this section.

title: Verify Search Nav Item exists within the Header.
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

User wants to Search a word/topic within MILB.COM
custom_steps:
WHEN

1. Tap/click on Search icon
2. Tap/click on the X button
3. Type in Search box
4. Select any of the matches
custom_expected:
THEN

1. Search box appears with X button
2. Search box closes
3. - If no matches are there then nothing is showing or suggesting
   - If there is a match, results show in a drop down list
4. User is navigated to the appropriate page
